name: Train (Brendan Keogh)
description:
A super basic little thing to get me back in the habit of making games after like a month off. This is a small vignette about being on a dark train at night and the shapes made by lights passing the window.

I've never really done anything before using 3D lighting or Unity's inbuilt animation system, so this was just a small test to learn that stuff. I might come back and do more with it in the future. I like the idea of having to try to read a book in this annoying light or something.

Mouse to look. Escape to quit.

(In 2017 I am challenging myself to make 50 little videogames to get more familiar with the tools. I make no guarantee that any of the games are good, but that's not really the point. This is game #9 or 50.)
